resources.Description: Common aluminium-titanium alloys from satellite frames and station hulls. Backbone of most orbital infrastructure.
Cryogenic wiring and power relays. Essential for high-efficiency power transfer and data conduits.
Recovered from solar arrays. Fragile but valuable for reprocessing into clean energy systems.
Heat-resistant materials and radiative coatings salvaged from radiator fins and engine plates.
Carbon-nano and graphene filaments once used in tethers and high-tensile structures.
Residual propellant and oxidizer compounds. Dangerous to harvest but highly sought after.
Fragments of nuclear batteries and reactor cores. Requires heavy shielding during retrieval.
Lenses, mirrors, and sensor crystals. Critical for advanced scanning and targeting systems.
Memory vaults and encrypted AI nodes. Salvage yields valuable code and rare trace materials.
Fragments of autonomous weapons, armor plating, and targeting modules. Often unstable.
Ancient satellite emblems, mission plaques, or early module fragments. Low practical use, high cultural value.
